rules: Rule1: Either the curator rejects the show, or if the furniture in the space is appreciated, then the artwork is viewed.
Rule2: Provided that a person purchases the artwork, the exhibition is successful.
Rule3: Assuming that a person commissions the artwork, the exhibition is successful.
Rule4: Whenever an exhibition is scheduled for the date, a person purchases the artwork or a person commissions the artwork.
Rule5: Provided that security is hired for the gallery, if the lighting in the space is adjusted, then the artwork is installed.
Rule6: The gallery being open during the hours implies that visitors are admitted to the show.
Rule7: Either the gallery is open during the hours or security is hired for the gallery.
Rule8: Provided that the media are invited to the show, if the exhibition is not successful, then a private viewing is scheduled for the date.
Rule9: Either the media are invited to the show or critics are invited to the show.
Rule10: If a press release is issued for the show, then provided critics are invited to the show, in case the exhibition is not successful, a private viewing is scheduled for the date.
Rule11: Under the condition that the show is promoted on social media, if critics are invited to the show, then whenever the exhibition is not successful, a private viewing is scheduled for the date.
Rule12: If the show receives local news coverage, then either a press release is issued for the show or the show is promoted on social media.
Rule13: Either the show receives local news coverage or the show is featured in an art magazine.
Rule14: Provided that the show is featured in an art magazine, the show is covered in a TV segment.
Rule15: The show being covered in a TV segment implies that the curator gives a radio interview.
Rule16: Assuming that the curator gives a radio interview, a press release is issued for the show or the show is promoted on social media.
Rule17: If the opening night of the show is a success, then whenever the public enjoys the show, the curator approves the show.
Rule18: Under the condition that the exhibition is extended, if the public enjoys the show, then the curator approves the show.
Rule19: Provided that critics praise the show, the curator approves the show.
Rule20: Either the show has poor attendance, or the opening night of the show is a success, or the exhibition is extended.
Rule21: If sponsorship is secured for the show, then the show receives corporate backing.
Rule22: The show receiving corporate backing implies that the show does not have poor attendance.
Rule23: Whenever the artwork is insured, the artwork is accepted.
Rule24: If the valuation of the artwork is completed, then the artwork is insured.
Rule25: Provided that a conservator is hired for the artwork, restoration is scheduled for the artwork.

Rule26: Either emergency funds are allocated from the budget, or if it is not the case that (whenever a person does not attend the show, the artwork is viewed) and the artwork is not damaged, then a conservator is hired for the artwork.
Rule27: In the event that a financial review of the budget is conducted, if emergency funds are allocated from the budget, then repairs to the space are completed.
Rule28: If a quarterly report is issued by the gallery, then whenever a board meeting is scheduled for the date, a financial review of the budget is conducted.
Rule29: Either a quarterly report is issued by the gallery or an annual audit of the gallery is completed.
Rule30: Assuming that an annual audit of the gallery is completed, if a board meeting is scheduled for the date, then a financial review of the budget is conducted.
Rule31: Provided that a collector is interested in the artwork, a person purchases the artwork.
Rule32: If a museum loan is requested for the artwork, then a person commissions the artwork.
Rule33: Under the condition that a private collector is contacted, a collector is interested in the artwork.
Rule34: Either a private collector is contacted or the museum director meets with the curator.
Rule35: If the museum director meets with the curator, then a loan agreement for the artwork is signed.
Rule36: Whenever the furniture in the space is arranged, the artwork is accepted.
Rule37: Either the artwork receives local delivery or, if shipping is arranged for the artwork, then the artwork is not transported.
Rule38: Either a lecture series is announced for the show or a workshop is scheduled for the date.
Rule39: Assuming that a workshop is scheduled for the date, then provided a special event is scheduled for the date, whenever the gallery is open during the hours, extended hours are in effect.
Rule40: Under the condition that a person attends the show, the exhibition is successful.
Rule41: Provided that it is not the case that the public enjoying the show implies critics praise the show, the artwork is not accepted.
Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that a loan agreement for the artwork being signed implies a museum loan is requested for the artwork, the artwork is transported.
Rule43: If it is not the case that a lecture series being announced for the show leads to a guest speaker being booked, then an educational program is cancelled.

Rule44: In the event that it is not the case that (it is not the case that the public enjoying the show implies critics praise the show) leading to the valuation of the artwork being completed, insurance for the artwork is approved.

Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that (it is not the case that the public enjoying the show implies critics praise the show) leads to the furniture in the space being arranged, the budget for the gallery is approved.

Rule46: If it is not the case that (it is not the case that (it is not the case that the public enjoying the show implies critics praise the show) implies the valuation of the artwork is completed) implies insurance for the artwork is not approved, then the premium for the artwork is paid.
Rule47: If it is not the case that a person does not attend the show implies the artwork is viewed, then the artwork is damaged.
Rule48: Provided that an exhibition is not scheduled for the date, the lighting in the space is adjusted.
Rule49: In the event that an exhibition is not scheduled for the date, the artwork is not installed.
Rule50: Under the condition that a person does not attend the show, the furniture in the space is appreciated.
Rule51: Provided that a person does not attend the show, the artwork is not viewed.
Rule52: In the event that the exhibition is not successful, the public enjoys the show.
facts: Fact1: Sponsorship is secured for the show.
Fact2: A board meeting is scheduled for the date.
Fact3: Shipping is arranged for the artwork.
Fact4: A special event is scheduled for the date.
Fact5: The curator does not approve the show.
Fact6: The curator does not reject the show.
Fact7: Visitors are not admitted to the show.
Fact8: A private viewing is not scheduled for the date.
Fact9: The premium for the artwork is not paid.
Fact10: Restoration is not scheduled for the artwork.
Fact11: Repairs to the space are not completed.
Fact12: The artwork does not receive local delivery.
Fact13: Extended hours are not in effect.
Fact14: A guest speaker is not booked.
Fact15: An educational program is not cancelled.
Fact16: The budget for the gallery is not approved.
